posts.name: Miles Irwin
posts.cooked:
Hello, I am a Student on Drew Robotics #8852 an FRC team based in San Francisco. Many teams have been using TPU treaded wheels however the options for Rev Maxswerve are less popular and require TTB wheels which are wider and make hot swapping wheels more time consuming and do not allow for the use of the rev calibration tool. this is why i made some edits to the 111 tread to fit over the rev wheels. Onshape link IMG_3519 1920×1440 145 KB IMG_3517 1920×1440 185 KB IMG_3514 1920×1440 178 KB

posts.name: Nelson Green (1108 Mentor Coach Electrical Programming)
posts.cooked: Thanks.  We are trying to decide for competition next month and this could help us.  Which TPU are you trying?
posts.display_username: Nelson Green (1108 Mentor Coach Electrical Programming)

posts.name: Miles Irwin
posts.cooked: the filament in the pic is just my personal sunlu 95A TPU, I do not recommend this because it resulted in lots of stringing and the spikes aren’t very well defined. When we actually print these we will use the NinjaTek 95A TPU which is more expensive but has resulted in better print quality.

reply_to_user.name: Nelson Green (1108 Mentor Coach Electrical Programming)

posts.name: viggy96
posts.cooked: Never even thought about the calibration tool compatibility with the TTB wheels. I wonder if someone has designed another tool to use with those wheels on MAXSwerve.

posts.cooked:
